metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3566 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavdevice58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter7 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavutil56 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libpostproc55 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswresample3 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswscale5 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2').
